com.siperian.sif.message

Class SiperianRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ApplyChangeListRequest, AuthenticateRequest, CleansePutRequest, CleanseRequest, CreateChangeListRequest, CreateTaskRequest, DescribeSiperianObjectRequest, ExecuteBatchBackfillAllRequest, ExecuteBatchGroupRequest, ExecuteBatchRequest, GenerateConstraintsRequest, GetAssignableUsersForTasksRequest, GetBatchGroupStatusRequest, GetEntityGraphRequest, GetLookupValueRequest, GetLookupValuesRequest, GetOneHopRequest, GetOrsListRequest, GetOrsMetadataRequest, GetResourcePrivilegesRequest, GetSearchResultsRequest, GetSystemTrustSettingsRequest, GetTaskLineageRequest, GetTasksRequest, GetTrustGraphDataRequest, GetTrustScoreRequest, GetValidationStatusRequest, ListSiperianObjectsRequest, ProcessRulesRequest, PutRequest, RegisterCustomIndexRequest, RegisterCustomTableObjectRequest, RegisterUsersRequest, RelationshipRequestBase, ResetBatchGroupRequest, SearchLookupValuesRequest, SetPasswordRequest, SiperianObjectRequest, SyncCustomResourcesRequest, UnregisterUsersRequest, UpdateTaskRequest, ValidateChangeListRequest, ValidateMetadataRequest, ValidateTasksRequest, WrappedRequest

    public class SiperianRequest
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Base class for all Siperian Hub requests.

    The following attributes are common to all requests. At a minimum, security credentials must be provided.

    • Username - Name of user making the request.
    • Password - User's password.
    • SecurityPayload - Alternative to username/password, or in addition. A security token or some other binary data used with a third-party authentication provider.
    • Ors ID - ORS to which the request is directed. This can be found in the MRM console in the Database Tool. If not specified, the request goes to the user's default ORS.
    • Interaction ID - Identifier for grouping requests into an interaction. Used by Activity Manager to process rules on the results of all requests of the same interaction.
    • AsynchronousOptions - Asynchronous processing options.

    Username, Password, and OrsId may alternatively be set automatically by SiperianClient.process(SiperianRequest) by using SiperianClient's properties.

    The following unchangeable attributes are common to all requests:

    • TransactionAttributeType - Specifies how a request can participate in transactions.
    • Request name - Class name of request object; useful for objects that extend SiperianRequest
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getInteractionId

      • setInteractionId

        public void setInteractionId(String interactionId)
        Optional: same interactionId can be set to multiple requests (Put, CleansePut, and so on), to enable MRM and AM to treat as the same "interaction".

        Using State Management, setting an interactionId on a PENDING record will block updates to the record without that interactionId. See PromotePendingXrefsRequest.

        Interactions can be useful with AM ProcessRulesRequest.

        If set to an empty string, "", the response will return a new interactionId created by MRM/AM that can be used with subsequent requests.

        Note: Interations are not the same as transactions.

        Parameters:
        interactionId - Some unique identifier.

      • getTransactionAttributeType

        public TransactionAttributeType getTransactionAttributeType()
        Each concrete request class will have a transaction type that it uses.

        This only matters when EjbSiperianClient is used, where your application code can process multiple requests in one transaction (and use rollback, and so on) by running within an EJB context or by creating a UserTransaction.

        If the subclass does not override this method, the default here is TransactionAttributeType.REQUIRED

        Returns:
        Never null, and constant for each request subclass.

      • getRequestName

        public final String getRequestName()
        Get name of the class of which this object is an instance.

        There is no corresponding set method. The method uses introspection to determine the class name. For example, if x is an instance of AuditRequest, then x.getRequestName() returns "AuditRequest".

        Returns:
        Class name (without the package name).

      • getAsynchronousOptions

        public AsynchronousOptions getAsynchronousOptions()
        Get asynchronous options.

        Returns:
        Null to process the request synchronously (the default), or object specifying details necessary to carry out the request asynchronously.

      • setAsynchronousOptions

        public void setAsynchronousOptions(AsynchronousOptions asynchronousOptions)
        Set asynchronous options.
        Parameters:
        asynchronousOptions - Null to process the request synchronously (the default), or AsynchronousOptions object specifying details necessary to carry out the request asynchronously.
